channel.title: Award name ideas?
channel.description:
Ok I have a short speech I am supposed to give in my public speaking class. I want to present an award to Steve Irwin(If we choose someone who has passed on we are supposed to act as they are still here. RIP Steve). I really don't know what I would name this award or exactly why I would be giving it. my teacher suggested giving it over his contributions to Australia and its citizens. There are quite a few things that could be addressed as an award. p to him any SERIOUS, appropriate name ideas and topics are greatly appreciated.
I would like to do the speech over an award to Steve b/c I looked up to him when I was young. I always wanted to travel to Australia to meet him, I guess that won't be happening. :(

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ya it was pretty rude.

oh ya i forgot, I type most of my word documents in google docs now it just more free space on my computer since my laptop only has a 320gb hdd. so I had may name included for when I printed it off.

now im going to have stalkers oh no.

Read full topic

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

you might want to remove your name

Read full topic

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

That’s just plain rude if they use it in a stereotypical way (redneck). Never understood what Redneck actually meant…

Read full topic

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

It happens with all accents and stuff. I really dont have much of an accent. and when i went to disney world in florida, some locals asked where we were from and we said Indiana and they started talking in an deep red neck accent mockingly, which was quite offensive since no one in Indiana that I personally know has an accent like that. plus florida is the most southern state even though they dont have a southern accent.

Read full topic

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

I’m English. I know it’s not accurate but it sounds amusing in real life, as would an Australian doing a British accent, because people impersonating British people assume we’re all speak like the Queen, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:11, topic:423550”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=526178.msg3833617#msg3833617 date=1322750592]

This is what I came up with. Its not the best, wish I could do better but english is my worst subject in school and I wrote it in like 15 minutes: https://docs.google.com/document/d/12DwXCG6wkZ2xHeSA-W03Q2eAgMZF2Pvv2Df7IqtE80Q/edit

edit: its suppose to be 1-2 minutes long, and I speak kinda slow.

Crykeey maate, thaet Crawcodile neerly bit me 'aaand awf! (Australian accents are hard to type).

Yeah that looks good, are you happy with it?

Isn’t how aussies speak to each other, not even fully bogans speak like that. Only ever people putting on the accent do, it’s sad how people think that’s all our country is for.
[/quote]
Yeah it’s supposed to comical, not sound like I actually come from Australia. If you’re truly offended I’ll remove it.[/quote]
I meet a lot of americans who do not understand it was a fake accent, you can keep it up.

Read full topic

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

A heart that will never mis-shapen.
The Heart that still beats even after death.
What he taught us will forever live within us?
A heart and soul pure and innocent as a flower, a flower that will never wilt.

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ok thanks for the suggestions. Idk how to really right this speech. the dedication one sounds really good thx. an award for his dedication to both wildlife and his country(watching him made me more aware of Australia and stuff, I’m sure I wasn’t the only one who became more aware).

Read full topic

item.title: Award name ideas?

item.description:

Dedication Award? He knowingly risked life to do what he loved.

item.title: Award name ideas?
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

I looked up to him when I was young too. How about an inspiration award? He died doing what he loved, which made him dedicated and loyal to his work.
